description: Discover the history, legends, and traditions of Santa Claus around the world

questions.question: What was Santa Claus's original name?
questions.funFact: He was a real person who lived in the 4th century in modern-day Turkey!
questions.story: Saint Nicholas was a Christian bishop known for his generosity and gift-giving, especially to the poor. The most famous story tells of him providing dowries for three poor sisters by throwing gold coins through their window at night, which landed in stockings drying by the fire.

questions.question: What color was Santa's suit before Coca-Cola advertisements?
questions.funFact: Santa wore green, brown, tan, and even purple before the red suit became standard!
questions.story: While Coca-Cola didn't invent the red-suited Santa, their 1930s advertisements by artist Haddon Sundblom helped standardize his appearance. Before then, Santa's outfit varied widely, often reflecting local traditions and artists' interpretations.

questions.question: In which country do children leave carrots for Santa's reindeer in wooden shoes?
questions.funFact: The children leave hay and carrots in their shoes for Sinterklaas's horse, not reindeer!
questions.story: In Dutch tradition, Sinterklaas (the basis for Santa Claus) arrives by steamboat from Spain and rides a white horse named Amerigo. Children leave their shoes out with carrots and hay for the horse, hoping to find them filled with treats the next morning.

questions.question: Which reindeer glows blue?
questions.story: According to polar legends, this special reindeer has fur that glows with a soft blue light, helping to guide Santa's sleigh through particularly stormy weather.

questions.question: Which elf builds robots?
questions.story: This innovative elf combines traditional toymaking with advanced robotics, creating unique hybrid toys that blend old-world charm with modern technology.

questions.question: Which sleigh flies underwater?
questions.funFact: The vehicle was built centuries ago!
questions.story: This special delivery sleigh can transform to travel underwater, allowing Santa to reach children living in underwater research stations and submarines.

questions.question: Which workshop grows toys?
questions.story: In this unique workshop, elves cultivate special plants that grow into toys, using magical fertilizer and careful tending to shape them as they develop.

questions.question: Which elf paints dreams?
questions.funFact: The paintings take months to complete!
questions.story: This talented elf creates paintings that come to life in children's dreams on Christmas Eve, giving them previews of the wonderful gifts they'll receive.

questions.question: Which reindeer makes music?
questions.story: This musical reindeer creates beautiful melodies while running through the air, each hoof strike producing a different note that combines into Christmas carols.

questions.question: Which elf controls weather?
questions.story: This powerful elf uses ancient magical tools to ensure perfect weather conditions for Santa's Christmas Eve journey around the world.

questions.question: Which workshop moves daily?
questions.story: This magical workshop can relocate itself to different parts of the North Pole each day, making it harder for curious explorers to find Santa's secret base.

questions.question: Which elf speaks to toys?
questions.story: This special elf has the unique ability to communicate with toys, helping ensure each gift finds its perfect match with a child on Christmas.

questions.question: Which sleigh bends time?
questions.story: This advanced sleigh can create temporal bubbles that allow Santa to deliver all presents in a single night by manipulating the flow of time.
